result.execSummary:
The defendant Roland Manriquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of probation in case# 15CF4932.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Consecutive to: with 75 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Day Reporting Center.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roland Manriquez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 75 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Day Reporting Center.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of probation in case# 15CF4932.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roland Manriquez in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, the enhancer of "Second and Subsequent" is DISMISSED.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Roland Manriquez not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests jury trial in case 15CF4932, this case to follow.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roland Manriquez in custody.  Patricia Daugherty for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
All terms and conditions previously set as to bail to remain in effect, including TOT to JusticePoint with all previous terms to continue.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Roland Manriquez not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered warrant withdrawn. Defendant has new case 15CF4932, currently set for prelim 2/25/16. Case adjourned in branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant missed court on 12/17/2016.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 02/22/2016 at 8:30am, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
No reply from defendant or surety.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.    Court orders defendant referred to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for final pre-trial on 12/17/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roland Manriquez in custody.    Student Intern Daniel Murphy under the supervision of Kelly O'Neill for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests bail hearing instead.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.    Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Roland Manriquez not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a scheduling conference. Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roland Manriquez in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
